name: Ivan V. v. City of New York
Roe v. Wade
question: Does the Constitution embrace a woman's right to terminate her pregnancy by abortion?
description: A case in which the court held that a woman's right to an abortion fell within the right to privacy granted in the Fourteenth Amendment.

name: Zicarelli v. New Jersey State Commission of Investigation
Stanley v. Illinois
question: Does the Illinois statutory scheme that assumes unwed fathers are unfit parents violate the Equal Protection Clause?

name: Reliance Electric Company v. Emerson Electric Company
Giglio v. United States
question: Is the prosecutionâ€™s failure to disclose a promise of immunity made to a key witness grounds for a new trial?

name: Willis v. Prudential Ins. Co. of America
Evansville-Vanderburgh Airport Authority District v. Delta Airlines, Inc.
Reed v. Reed
question: Did the Idaho Probate Code violate the Equal Protection Clause of the Fourteenth Amendment?
description: A case in which the Court established the unconstitutionality of the Idaho Probate Code that stated "males must be preferred to females" when appointing administrators of estates.

name: United States v. Christian Echoes National Ministry, Inc.
United States v. Chas. Pfizer & Co.
California Motor Transport Company v. Trucking Unlimited
Miller v. California
question: Is the sale and distribution of obscene materials by mail protected under the First Amendment's freedom of speech guarantee?
description: A case in which the Court found that "obscene materials" do not have First Amendment protection.

name: Kleindienst v. Mandel
question:
1. Did Attorney General Kleindienst violate the First Amendment rights of the scholars and students who invited Mandel to the United States by refusing to allow Mandel to enter the country?
  2. Is the statute giving Kleindienst this discretionary power unconstitutional on its face?

name: Caplin v. Marine Midland Grace Trust Company of New York
Port of Portland v. United States
United States v. Allegheny-Ludlum Steel Corporation
Hawaii v. Standard Oil Company of California
National Labor Relations Board v. Burns International Security Services, Inc.
Sarno v. Illinois Crime Investigating Commission
question: If an unwilling witness invokes his privilege against self-incrimination under the Fifth Amendment, can a state make that witness testify by granting that witness immunity?

name: Argersinger v. Hamlin
question: Do the Sixth and Fourteenth Amendments guarantee a right to counsel to defendants who are accused of committing misdemeanors?

name: Eisenstadt v. Baird
question: Did the Massachusetts law violate the right to privacy acknowledged in Griswold v. Connecticut and protected from state instrusion by the Fourteenth Amendment?

name: First National City Bank v. Banco Nacional de Cuba
Brunette Machine Works, Ltd. v. Kockum Industries, Inc.
Federal Power Commission v. Florida Power & Light Company
Gooding v. Wilson
question: Does the Georgia statute prohibiting the use of "opprobrious words or abusive language, tending to cause a breach of the peace" violate the First Amendment as applied to the states by the Fourteenth Amendment?

name: Fein v. Selective Service System Local Board No. 7 of Yonkers, New York
Superintendent of Ins. of N. Y. v. Bankers Life & Casualty Co.
Furman v. Georgia
question: Does the imposition and carrying out of the death penalty in these cases constitute cruel and unusual punishment in violation of the Eighth and Fourteenth Amendments?
description: A case in which the Court found that the death penalty constituted cruel and unusual punishment in the case of an accidental burglary death.

name: United States v. Standard Oil Company of California
Moose Lodge No. 107 v. Irvis
question: Did the discriminatory practices violate the Equal Protection Clause of the Fourteenth Amendment?

name: International Union of Operating Engineers, Local 150, AFL-CIO v. Flair Builders, Inc.
Branzburg v. Hayes
question: Is the requirement that news reporters appear and testify before state or federal grand juries an abridgement of the freedoms of speech and press as guaranteed by the First Amendment?
description: A case in which the Court held that requiring reporters to testify before a grand jury does not violate freedom of press or speech in the First Amendment.

name: Kirby v. Illinois
question: Does due process require that an accused be advised of his right to counsel before an identification that takes place before the accused has been charged formally?

name: Securities and Exchange Commission v. Medical Committee for Human Rights
Wisconsin v. Yoder
question: Did Wisconsin's requirement that all parents send their children to school at least until age 16 violate the First Amendment by criminalizing the conduct of parents who refused to send their children to school for religious reasons?
description: A case in which the Court held that the First Amendment prohibited the state of Wisconsin to require Amish children to attend public school beyond the eighth grade.

name: United States v. 12 200-ft. Reels of Super 8MM. Film
Board of Regents of State Colleges v. Roth
question: Does the due process clause of the Fourteenth Amendment require that a state university provide a one-year contract employee a hearing and reasons when he is not retained after the termination of his contract?

name: Pipefitters Local Union No. 562 v. United States
S & E Contractors, Inc. v. United States
United States v. Caldwell
question: Did the First Amendment's protection of freedom of the press protect Caldwell from appearing and testifying before the grand jury?

name: Sixty-seventh Minnesota State Senate v. Beens
United States v. Mississippi Chemical Corporation
question: Were the Class â€œCâ€ stock purchases deductible interest?

name: Santobello v. New York
question: Can a defendant seek a new trial when a new prosecutor fails to abide by the terms of his predecessorâ€™s plea agreement?
description: A case in which the Court held that a defendant can seek a new trial when a new prosecutor fails to abide by the terms of his predecessorâ€™s plea agreement.

name: National Labor Relations Board v. Scrivener
United States v. Scotland Neck City Board of Education
Morrissey v. Brewer
question: Did the due process clause of the Fourteenth Amendment require the Iowa Board of Parole to give an evidentiary hearing prior to revoking the paroles of Morrissey and Booker?

name: Weber v. Aetna Casualty & Surety Co.
Younger v. Gilmore
question: Does a state have an affirmative constitutional duty to provide prison inmates with law libraries or professional legal assistance?

name: Gravel v. United States
question: Did the subpoena of Senator Gravel's aide violate the Speech and Debate Clause of Article I of the Constitution?

name: Adams v. Williams
question: Does the Fourth Amendment allow a police officer, acting only on a tip from an informant, to approach a person and remove a weapon concealed in the personâ€™s waistband?
description: A case in which the Court held that the Fourth Amendment allows a police officer, acting only on a tip from an informant, to approach a person and remove a weapon concealed in the personâ€™s waistband.

name: Lloyd Corporation, Ltd. v. Tanner
question: Were Tanner and the other protestors' First Amendment right to free speech violated by Lloyd's refusal to allow them to distribute handbills on mall property?

name: Police Department of the City of Chicago v. Mosley
question: Does the Chicago ordinance violate the freedom of speech Clause of the First Amendment?

name: Chevron Oil Company v. Huson
question: Is Louisiana statute of limitations inconsistent with the admiralty laches doctrine? Should Rogrique be retroactively applied?

name: Wright v. Council of City of Emporia
Commissioner v. First Security Bank of Utah, N. A.
Atlantic Coast Line R. Co. v. Erie Lackawanna R. Co.
National Labor Relations Board v. Plasterers' Union International Assn., AFL-CIO
Central Hardware Company v. National Labor Relations Board
Norfolk & Western R. Company v. Nemitz
Board of Regents of University of Texas System v. New Left Education Project
Iowa Beef Packers, Inc. v. Thompson
United States v. Topco Associates, Inc.
Gelbard v. United States
question: Can grand jury witnesses invoke the federal statute prohibiting illegal wiretapping as a defense to civil contempt charges based on their refusal to testify regarding information revealed by those illegal taps?

name: Grubbs v. General Electric Credit Corporation
In re Pappas
question: Did the First Amendment's freedom of the press protect Pappas from appearing and testifying before the grand jury?

name: Flood v. Kuhn
question:
1. Was professional baseballâ€™s reserve system subject to federal antitrust law?

Was professional baseball subject to state antitrust laws?

name: Federal Trade Commission v. Sperry & Hutchinson Company
Andrews v. Louisville & Nashville Railroad Company
Haines v. Kerner
question: Does an inmate have the right to offer proof of an alleged injury before his case is dismissed on the grounds of failure to state a cause of action for said injury?
description: A case in which the Court held that a prisoner has the right to submit proof of his alleged injuries before his case is dismissed.

name: National Labor Relations Board v. Nash-Finch Company
Kastigar v. United States
question: Can the government, by granting immunity from the use of compelled testimony in future prosecutions, force a witness who invokes the Fifth Amendment to testify?

name: D. H. Overmyer Company, Inc., of Ohio v. Frick
question: Can the constitutional right to notice be surrendered as part of consideration for a contract?

name: Barker v. Wingo
question: Can the right to a speedy trial be implicitly waived?

name: United States v. Midwest Video Corporation
Allied Chemical & Alkali Workers of America, Local Union No. 1 v. Pittsburgh Plate Glass Company, Chemical Division
Federal Power Commission v. Louisiana Power & Light Company
Affiliated Ute Citizens of Utah v. United States
United States v. Louisiana (Louisiana Boundary Case)
Dunn v. Blumstein
question: Did Tennessee's durational residency requirements violate the Equal Protection Clause of the Fourteenth Amendment?

name: United States v. Generes
question: Can an individual who is both employee and shareholder in a corporation claim the corporationâ€™s losses as business bad debt for tax purposes?
description: A case in which the Court held that an individual who is both employee and shareholder in a corporation cannot claim the corporationâ€™s losses as business bad debt for tax purposes.

name: The Bremen v. Zapata Off-Shore Company
Sierra Club v. Morton
question: Did the Sierra Club adequately establish that it had a sufficient stake in the development of the Mineral King Valley to establish standing for a suit under the Administrative Procedure Act?
description: A case in which the Court held that a plaintiff must show that he has suffered a direct injury or will suffer a direct injury as a result of the defendantâ€™s actions in order to have standing to sue under the Administrative Procedure Act.

name: United States v. United States District Court for the Eastern District of Michigan
question: Did the wiretapping violate the Fourth Amendment?

name: Murel v. Baltimore City Criminal Court
question: Did the Maryland Defective Delinquency Law violate the constitutional rights of prisoners who were committed to a mental health facility?

name: Dukes v. Warden, Conn. State Prison
Deepsouth Packing Company, Inc. v. Laitram Corporation
Perry v. Sindermann
question:
(1) Was Sindermann entitled to a full trial in District Court?

(2) Was Sindermann entitled to a hearing before the Board of Regents?

name: Diffenderfer v. Central Baptist Church of Miami, Florida, Inc.
Ford Motor Company v. United States
Apodaca v. Oregon
question: Is a defendant's right to a trial by jury in a criminal case in a state court (as protected by the Sixth and Fourteenth Amendments) violated if the accused is convicted by a less-than-unanimous jury?
